definition: to suss out/to figure out/to ascertain
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Track your boss's peevespatterns, then eliminate the triggers within your control.
sentences.chinese: 你要摸清你的老板的脾气，并尽可能消除隐患。

sentences.english: Track your boss's peeves and patterns, then eliminate the triggers within your control.
sentences.chinese: 你要摸清你的老板的脾气，并尽可能消除隐患。

sentences.english: Objective To determine the stability of Potassium Iodate of different contents in pale vinegar.
sentences.chinese: 目的摸清碘酸钾加入白醋中不同含量的稳定性。

sentences.english: Let me tell you how to learn more about him .
sentences.chinese: 我来告诉你们怎么进一步摸清他的底细。

sentences.english: Survey into market demand for talents in Shenzhen;
sentences.chinese: 只有摸清市场需求，才能做到购销两旺。

sentences.english: We must find out exactly how things stand here, or we'll have nothing to report.
sentences.chinese: 咱们得把情况摸清楚，要不回去就得交白卷。

sentences.english: You can get the feel of a compact car in no time.
sentences.chinese: 你很快就能把小型车摸清楚。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To study the bioecological characteristics of Cordyceps sinensis (BerK.
sentences.chinese: 目的摸清冬虫夏草的生态生物学特性。

sentences.english: To get the password this war room to ascertain the bearing have to sneak into the headquarters.
sentences.chinese: 要拿到密码本就必须潜入司令部摸清作战室的方位。

sentences.english: What place is this? I should try to make it clear.
sentences.chinese: 这是那里？我要试著摸清楚它。

sentences.english: He felt out his parents on that matter.
sentences.chinese: 他摸清了他父母对那个问题的看法。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To study the bioecological characteristics of Cordyceps sinensis (BerK. ) Sacc.
sentences.chinese: 目的摸清冬虫夏草的生态生物学特性。

sentences.english: Contact business members of the delegation directly and feel out their intentions.
sentences.chinese: 直接同代表团的商务人员接触，摸清他们的意图。

sentences.english: I had a rare opportunity to become acquainted with their habits.
sentences.chinese: 真是机会难得，我摸清了它们的习惯了。

sentences.english: We should be clear about our industrial foundation and the agricultural foundation as well.
sentences.chinese: 摸清现实，不仅是工业基础，还有个农业基矗。
我很快就摸清了他的底细。

definition: to find out/to ascertain/to get to the bottom of/to clarify
to clarify/to fully understand
to have a clear view (of a situation)/to fish for information/fact-finding
to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom)/to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
variant of 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
to be well aware of sth/to understand clearly
know yourself, know your enemy (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
to know what's going on
radix/base (math.)
whereabouts/(lose) track (of)
lit. to follow the vine to get to the melon/to track sth following clues
to inspect/to run through a checklist/to take stock/to audit
to figure out how to do something
to ascertain/to verify
to make discreet inquiries/to scout out
to penetrate deeply/thorough
to see clearly/to recognize/to realize
